## Welcome to our Case Study Repository!

Here, you can practice technical and analytical skills using real-life scenarios. The case studies, contributed by FETPs and health ministries worldwide, feature data that is either generated or anonymized for training purposes.

Find a case study of interest with the table below, and click on the link to open it in the appropriate language for you. 

```{r echo = F}
table_cases <- tribble(
  ~Name, ~Link, ~Creator,  ~Language, ~Tool, ~Location, ~Scale, ~Disease, ~Keywords, ~Technical_Complexity, ~Methodological_Complexity, 
  "Fulton", 'pages/fulton-en.html', "Applied Epi", "English", "R", "United States", "Local", "COVID-19", "COVID-19; SARS-COV-2; Outbreak", "Intermediate", "Basic",  
  "Oswego ES", "pages/oswego-es.html", "US CDC (adapted)", "EspaÃ±ol", "R", "Estados Unidos", "Local", "Gastrointestinal", "Gastrointestinal;Brote", "Intermedio", "Intermedio"
)

```


```{r, echo = F, eval = T}

# Render the table with DT, making the 'Link' column clickable with custom text
datatable(table_cases, escape = FALSE, filter = "top", options = list(
  columnDefs = list(
    list(targets = 2, render = JS(
      "function(data, type, row, meta) {
        if(type === 'display') {
          var linkText = 'Link'; // Use the 'Name' column as the display text
          data = '<a href=\"' + data + '\">' + linkText + '</a>';
        }
        return data;
      }"
    ))
  )
), callback = JS("table.page.len(5).draw();"))

```
